topic.title: Cloning Zeromail
topic.body: I try cloning zeromail (from button and manual) but if a user creates mailbox i get file write error. Also no content.json exists on /data/users/ Any help?

topic.title: How do i add multiple files allowed in data/users/content.json
topic.body:
I am trying to add more than on json innner path content json in format:
"files_allowed": "data.json", 
"files_allowed": "x.json", 

But when i try to sign --innerpath one of two disappears...Anyone know what is happening?

topic.title: Is there a way to send a copy of my json file to another user?

5_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx.body:
> [nofish](#comment_280_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It should work this way: 
> 
> Create new site, 
> Copy files from data/[siteyouwantoclone] to data/[yournewsiteaddress]
> Delete everything from data/users directory except content.json
> zeronet.py siteSign yournewsiteaddress --inner_path data/users/content.json --publish
> zeronet.py siteSign yournewsiteaddress --publish

Copy and replace everything?

> [nofish](#comment_283_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Fixed the cloning via the webui

Thanks a lot !

6_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx.body:
Site:1A68bo..fT2V data/1A68boXS5fX88zKHuT96VcRpPxvXV6fT2V/data/users/content.jso
n load error: ValueError: Invalid \escape: line 14 column 34 (char 313) in Conte
ntManager.py line 48 > __init__.py line 290 > __init__.py line 338 > decoder.py
line 366 > decoder.py line 382
Ok thanks i ll try it again

> [gomzik](#comment_56_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ): I look to my file, where I use something like. Try following:
> {
>   "files_allowed": "(data|x).json"
> }
> 
> without backslash

Working now thanks a lot!

1_14Q3Go381PvQJ8GCUv74AE8bqXd8F9BoVC.body:
> [nofish](#comment_342_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is an optional files feature that allows parts to be downloaded only if your client requests it, see site http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Gif7PqWTzVWDQ42Mo7np3zXmGAo3DXc7h (has 1000+ videos but they only downloaded if your browsers requests them)
> The huge social network problem will be solved by merger sites, where the profiles will acts as separate sites, so you only get the updates/only stores the ones you are following.

Site merging would be great and possibilities endless!

1_1FLf4EythVqZASkMdARs4DXdHeugh3USYq.body: Amazing work congrats. Maybe next step would be easiest app deployment through a web framework built ed for zeronet! I dont thing its by chance that no other apps made rather than apps developed by zeronet devs
And maybe a embedded wallet for zeronet would be nice too!

> [nofish](#comment_362_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is third-party sites (eg. 0chan). It's not that hard: the Chat tutorial @ ZeroBlog is less than 100 lines of code.

Yes but chat with no functionality. It gets hard to built zeroapps you need to study and learn a lot to make something new or you have to be a very experienced web dev. Either way i keep reading and learning and maybe someday i ll make my own or someone can save me and get a framework working :)

> [nofish](#comment_363_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It has functionality: You can submit messages and it's get distributed over the network. This is all you need to build ZeroNet apps.

:) I get your point but building a chat 100 lines of code and building a talk forum 3500 lines of code is a big difference at least for me with no web developement experience!

1_1GCsW9TFfjDsvcdmKPADq1n8Q3ha72UtDQ.body: I think other sites would be more useful than a market. For a market we need a lot of people and a complex system for escrowing antispamming antiscamming rating ! Also who will take responsibility for creating an official market that people will buy/sell drugs too or it will have some kind of censorship?

> [3x71nc7](#comment_13_1Q8iqH31cKCqynoJRxR2PfJhzQr8wHdiHr): That's not entirely true. From the laws perspective everyone visiting(and therefore hosting) the site is liable. The main liability is at the creators end, because he has the private key and could remove illegal content.

Agreed

> [dafleroh](#comment_5_19KtmLJftUcLg5ZtwmAfe616J2vp6iJBHU): Ugh, its so trivial. I do not think there is a right answer, its speculative. If I create and upload a market platform with no visible intent for illegal use, can I still get in trouble? All I did was create a market source code, I do not host or maintain it. I just threw it out and let people do what they want with it. You cannot be prosecuted. Especially if the owner "throws away" the key to edit the site. Now, you could say that those hosting are responsible, but that's not realistically prosecutable. As I said, I think this is so out-there we will have to wait and see what happens.. I hope the platform catches on, though.  noiamo: Agreed

I still think other apps are more important for now a lot of people last days lets see what will happen!

1_1yq6ABe15TborB8sGQb1pGcZgUd6eu3WJ.body: Noone can censor you even if you have .bit domain registry! Censorship will come from the user sharing/seeding in a way that if your content is not right/good for them they wont share it!

1_17oYQdLkvyzEVPH3hXRtK3ru4FLNKZUD3b.body: Proof of work and proof of burn to avoiding spamming we cant do anything else but to solve technically or maybe find a way to block some content depending on what a community wants or don;t want to see

11_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx.body:
> [nofish](#comment_519_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): You can encrypt it to other user's public key (ZeroMail do this), there is no IP stored for users, so no way to send directly.

Encrypt it and write it to my json and other could read it from there right? I wanna send it or write it directly to other user  file/folder or even better create a new file for each user, for example a message, contract etc. Can i do that? Is this the correct way - is it safe to do something like that?

> [nofish](#comment_520_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): The problem is you don't know other user's IP address (it would be a privacy issue), so you can't communicate directly with them.

I dont know user's ip but i know .onion address of the user right?

13_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx.body:
> [nofish](#comment_533_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): sorry, don't understand please explain. you can set provide per-user rules the same way as max_size

Yes but per user rule on which json someone is allowed to write? Eg admin.json and user.json admins can write to admin.json but users cant

I am not asking for extra signers i want 2 different group of users to able to write only in json files for their group for e.g "nofish@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 100000 , x.json} "nofish2@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 100000, y.json } so user 1 could only write to x.json and user 2 only to y.json. Per file per user permission

> [nofish](#comment_535_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Like I said you can set any other rules the same way as max_size, so add files_allowed there

So i can add something like "nofish1@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 100000, "files_allowed": "x.json" } , "nofish2@zeroid.bit": { "max_size": 100000, "files_allowed": "y.json" }  . So the general rule is in permission rules and above is applied to every user

> [nofish](#comment_536_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It should work.

Thanks a lot mate!
